channel.title: Performance on Sujith Quintelier
channel.description: Recent content in Performance on Sujith Quintelier

item.title: github: Fast mode for Claude Opus 4.6 is now in preview for GitHub Copilot
item.description:
GitHub Copilot is rolling out a research/public preview of Claude Opus 4.6 “Fast mode.” The mode increases output token generation speed by up to 2.5×.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Improved pull request Files changed – February 5 updates
item.description:
GitHub updated the new pull request “Files changed” experience with CODEOWNERS validation and performance improvements.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Showing tool calls and other improvements to Copilot chat on the web
item.description:
GitHub Copilot Chat on github.com now shows tool call details in chat responses and includes additional performance and UX improvements.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Faster loading for GitHub Issues
item.description:
GitHub reports a significant performance improvement for GitHub Issues: 35% of issue views now load in under 200ms, up from 2% at the start of the year. The change is announced on the GitHub Blog as the first in a series of improvements to issue loading performance.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: k8s: Headlamp in 2025: Project Highlights
item.description:
Headlamp’s 2025 recap highlights major growth: the project joined Kubernetes SIG UI, absorbed many community contributions via the Linux Foundation mentorship, and shipped several UX and platform features — multi-cluster views, Projects for grouping resources, a taskbar/activities model, improved search and map, OIDC/auth improvements, Helm/App Catalog enhancements, plugin ecosystem growth (including an AI Assistant), and performance, accessibility, and security upgrades.

  • Source: Kubernetes Official Blog

item.title: vscode: Building docfind: Fast Client-Side Search with Rust and WebAssembly
item.description:
The article describes building docfind, a high-performance client-side search engine implemented in Rust and compiled to WebAssembly, and highlights how GitHub Copilot sped up development.

  • Source: Visual Studio Code

item.title: dotnet: Top .NET Blog Posts of 2025
item.description:
A year-end roundup of the most-read .NET blog posts published in 2025, highlighting coverage of .NET 10, AI in .NET, performance improvements, and developer tooling, with links back to the original .NET Blog.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: github: Improved performance for GitHub Actions workflows page
item.description:
The GitHub Actions workflows page now handles very large workflows (more than 300 jobs) by using lazy loading for smoother performance, and it also adds the ability to filter jobs to help navigate large workflows.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: dotnet: .NET 10 Networking Improvements
item.description:
The article announces networking improvements in .NET 10, highlighting updates across HTTP, WebSockets, security, and related areas to enhance performance, reliability, and the developer experience.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Azure Load Testing in Italy North
item.description:
Azure Load Testing (part of Azure App Testing) is now generally available in the Italy North region, allowing customers there to run high-scale load tests and simulations to find performance bottlenecks.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In development] Private Preview: Azure HorizonDB
item.description:
Azure HorizonDB for PostgreSQL is a new managed PostgreSQL offering now in private preview that emphasizes high performance, large autoscaling storage (up to 128 TB), and rapid compute scalability (up to 3,072 vCores), claiming up to 3× faster performance than open-source PostgreSQL.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In development] Private Preview: Azure Boost remote storage throughput and network bandwidth enhancements
item.description:
Microsoft has opened a private preview for performance enhancements in the latest Azure Boost architecture that improve remote storage throughput and network bandwidth. Azure Boost offloads virtualization functions (networking, storage, host management) and these updates aim to boost I/O and network performance for VMs and cloud services.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Azure DocumentDB high-performance storage
item.description:
Azure DocumentDB public preview introduces high-performance storage that enables larger, faster workloads on fewer nodes with much higher capacity, IOPS and throughput per physical shard.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Index Advisor for Azure DocumentDB
item.description:
Public preview of Index Advisor integrated into the DocumentDB for VS Code extension. It helps you view and debug database performance and uses natural-language recommendations to suggest optimal indexing and best practices for MongoDB workloads.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Application Gateway for Containers – Slow start
item.description:
Slow start is now generally available for Application Gateway for Containers. The load balancing algorithm gradually increases traffic to newly created pods over a configurable window to improve stability and performance during backend scale‑up.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Azure SQL Managed Instance Next-gen General Purpose service tier
item.description:
Microsoft announced the Generally Available Next‑gen General Purpose service tier for Azure SQL Managed Instance, delivering major performance improvements along with increased compute flexibility while preserving cost advantages and the simplicity of a fully managed PaaS.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Priority-based execution in Azure Cosmos DB
item.description:
Azure Cosmos DB now generally available: priority-based execution can be enabled so high-priority requests are favored during contention, with low-priority requests throttled first to allow critical operations to proceed on a best-effort basis.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Vector indexing performance improvements in Azure Cosmos DB for NoSQL
item.description:
Azure Cosmos DB for NoSQL now generally available: vector indexing performance improvements deliver faster vector inserts and index builds, reducing end-to-end ingestion and indexing times for large AI workloads through algorithmic enhancements.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Premium v2 tier in Azure API Management
item.description:
Azure announced general availability of the API Management Premium v2 tier, a more powerful and scalable option designed for enterprise-scale API management with improved performance and expanded capacity.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public preview: Support for large volume breakthrough mode
item.description:
Azure NetApp Files now has a public preview for large-volume Breakthrough mode, which delivers extreme performance and scalability for demanding HPC and EDA workloads. It supports volumes up to 2 PiB and can deliver throughput up to 50 GiB/s depending on workload characteristics.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: dotnet: Introducing F# 10
item.description:
The blog post announces F# 10, highlighting new language features, performance improvements, and tooling enhancements that ship with .NET 10.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Support 5x churn in Azure Site Recovery
item.description:
Azure Site Recovery is available in Public Preview with support for up to 5x churn, enabling up to 500 MB/s per VM. This update improves replication throughput so customers can protect high‑IOPS, high‑throughput workloads with Site Recovery.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: .NET 10
item.description:
Microsoft announced .NET 10 is generally available, delivering a faster, more secure, and more capable platform for modern development. The release improves performance, productivity, and security across the stack, and C# 14 adds language refinements for more natural, expressive coding.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Scheduler profile configuration for AKS
item.description:
Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) is releasing a public preview that adds scheduler profile configuration with an in-tree plugin, enabling organizations running complex Kubernetes workloads to customize pod placement policies.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Ultra Disk’s new flexible provisioning model
item.description:
Azure Ultra Disk is now generally available with a new flexible provisioning model that lets you configure capacity, IOPS and throughput (MBPS) more independently so you can better tailor and optimize disk performance for your workloads.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Azure Database for PostgreSQL read replicas with Premium SSD v2
item.description:
Azure Database for PostgreSQL Flexible Server now supports configuring read replicas (in-region and geo-replicas) with the Premium SSD v2 storage tier in Public Preview, enabling scale-out for read-heavy workloads and improved performance by offloading read operations.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: dotnet: How Copilot Studio uses .NET and WebAssembly for performance and innovation
item.description:
Microsoft explains how Copilot Studio uses .NET to run AI agents consistently across platforms and to bring performant, innovative agent execution to the web via WebAssembly.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Query Advisor in Azure Cosmos DB
item.description:
Azure Cosmos DB for NoSQL now offers Query Advisor as generally available in the .NET SDK. Query Advisor analyzes your query structure and gives clear, actionable recommendations to help you write faster, more efficient queries.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: VM vCore customization features disabling simultaneous multi-threading (SMT/HT) and constrained cores
item.description: Azure announced a public preview of VM vCore customization that gives customers greater control over virtual CPU configuration. The preview introduces two capabilities: disabling simultaneous multithreading (SMT/Hyper‑Threading) on vCPUs, and constraining the number of cores exposed to the guest. These options help optimize single‑threaded workload performance, reduce license costs by limiting visible cores, and improve CPU isolation and predictable performance. The features are available in public preview and can be configured through Azure management interfaces.

item.title: github: GitHub MCP Server now supports GitHub Projects and more
item.description:
The GitHub MCP Server adds native support for GitHub Projects via a new management tool and deploys multiple strategies to reduce the server’s footprint, alongside other improvements noted in the changelog.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: PostgreSQL 18 on Azure Database for PostgreSQL – Flexible Server
item.description:
Azure Database for PostgreSQL – Flexible Server now offers PostgreSQL 18 in public preview, providing early access to the latest performance, scalability, and developer productivity improvements.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Azure Integrated HSM
item.description:
Microsoft announced the public preview of Azure Integrated HSM, a hardware security module (HSM) cache and crypto accelerator for virtual machines, designed to enhance the security and performance of cryptographic operations for customers with heavy crypto workloads.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: dotnet: Preparing for the .NET 10 GC (DATAS)
item.description:
The .NET 10 Garbage Collector introduces DATAS, a new adaptive mechanism that adjusts heap size automatically. The article explains how DATAS behavior differs from the previous Server GC, and gives guidance on when to tune GC settings or disable DATAS depending on your application’s workload and performance goals.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Azure Container Storage v2.0.0 now with NVMe performance boost, open source, and no service fees
item.description:
Azure Container Storage (ACStor) v2.0.0 is now generally available, offering up to 7× higher IOPS and 4× lower latency on local NVMe compared to v1.3.1. The release positions ACStor as the fastest storage option for Azure Kubernetes Service, is open source, and carries no service fees.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: dotnet: Application Insights Code Optimizations for .NET Apps
item.description:
Application Insights Code Optimizations for .NET Apps helps .NET developers detect performance bottlenecks and receive AI-driven code improvement suggestions via GitHub Copilot integration, streamlining diagnostics and optimizations within the .NET ecosystem.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: vscode: Introducing auto model selection (preview)
item.description:
VS Code now offers auto model selection (preview) to automatically choose the best AI model for faster responses, reduced rate limiting, and a 10% discount on premium requests for paid users.

  • Source: Visual Studio Code

item.title: github: Pull request “Files changed” public preview experience – September 11 updates
item.description:
GitHub updated the public preview of the pull request “Files changed” page on September 11, 2025, improving performance and raising the file limit. The release also adds a single-file view and other refinements for a smoother review experience.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: dotnet: Performance Improvements in .NET 10
item.description:
A blog post announcing and summarizing hundreds of performance improvements in .NET 10, offering a guided tour of enhancements across the platform to make apps faster, more memory-efficient, and more responsive.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: github: The dashboard-feed page gets a refreshed, faster experience
item.description:
GitHub updated the /dashboard-feed page to align it with improvements made to the homepage “For you” feed, delivering a refreshed, more consistent, and faster experience across the site.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Azure Ultra Disk Price Reduction in Central US
item.description:
Azure has made a price reduction for Ultra Disks in the Central US region generally available. Ultra Disks provide extremely high performance and sub-millisecond latency for demanding VM workloads, and the price cut reduces costs for those workloads in that region.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Azure Ultra Disk Price Reduction in UK South
item.description:
Azure Ultra Disk is now generally available with a price reduction in the UK South region. Ultra Disk is Azure’s highest-performance block storage for virtual machines, offering consistent sub-millisecond latency and very high throughput and IOPS, making it suitable for demanding enterprise production workloads.

  • Source: Azure Updates
